page.title: 13Law and Order
page.content: The area surrounding Bagnall is policed by community officers from Endon. They patrol the area at no given time and while they are on patrol they usually call into farms to talk to the owner to find out if he has any complaints or information for them. The most common complaint is the dumping of rubbish on farmland and culprits are usually caught. With there being no speed limit in Bagnall it is becoming increasingly dangerous for the customers of the "Stafford Arms" to park in the narrow lanes beside the public house. At Christmas the police organise special patrols to protect the Christmas trees in the nurseries and the turkey farms from seasonal thefts.
